text: For Drag and Drop templates, is it possible to remove custom modules default `Styles` tab? Or at least, the default padding so it'd be a blank tab.

The Padding styles option is universal to all email modules — it’s more of a “wrapper” for modules than a true style field.

Up until about two weeks ago, when the “Styles” tab was added to email modules, the Padding toggle was located at the bottom of the content tab for every module. So, it’s just you: the Styles tab _did in fact_ just suddenly appear on your modules.

So, effectively: no, there isn’t a way to remove it. If you’d like to advise users to not use the padding option, I’d suggests adding inline help text to the module instructing them to keep it disabled.
Our designers are asking for specs while creating custom email templates. Where can I find them?

hey <@U07DKV7H1T2> - there are no real specs out there.
If you're about to create an HTML email template you have almost no limitations.
If you're planning to use the dnd email builder the width of the email is limited to 600px (an html email shouldn't exceed this either).

Additionally I would tell the designer to not go crazy with the templates because you might run into email client issues (i.e: Outlook and GMail have different ways to display an email).

A good source of "What is possible in emails" is:
<http://caniemail.com|caniemail.com>

:arrow_up: this

Additionally I'd add that you might disable the padding in custom modules - but this can bring up other topics (i.e responsiveness)
